Sentencas: Acceptor doping of oxides generally results in the formation of charge-compensating oxygen vacancies, leading to enhanced ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study

Sentencas: Ca-doped LaFeO3 is one such example which has been considered for use in cathode materials of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study

Sentencas: In the present work, we determine the structural, electronic, and magnetic properties of individual intrinsic and extrinsic point defects and defect clusters in Ca-doped LaFeO3.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study

Sentencas: We find that the concentration of oxygen vacancies can increase through the formation of dopant-vacancy clusters.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study

Sentencas: Oxygen vacancy concentration will influence the diffusivity of oxygen which in La-based perovskites is shown to be governed by the oxygen vacancy concentration.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study

Sentencas: We also calculate the interaction between dopant ion and oxygen vacancies and find that oxygen vacancies will not be trapped by the dopant species as found in other oxide materials.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study

Sentencas: These findings suggest an enhanced conductivity of oxygen in LaFeO3 under Ca doping.
Titulo: Electronic properties of Ca doped LaFeO3: A first-principles study
